---
title: "webhook_authorisation_response.json"
---

## High-level description
This JSON file represents a fixture for an Adyen webhook authorization response. It contains a simulated response structure that Adyen would send to notify about an authorization event, including details about the transaction, payment method, and available operations.

## Symbols

### Root Object
#### Description
The root object of the JSON structure represents the entire webhook notification from Adyen.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| live | string | Indicates whether the notification is from a live environment or not |
| notificationItems | array | Contains a list of notification items |

### notificationItems
#### Description
An array containing notification request items. In this case, there is only one item.

### NotificationRequestItem
#### Description
Represents the details of a single notification request.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| additionalData | object | Contains additional information about the transaction |
| amount | object | Represents the transaction amount |
| eventCode | string | Indicates the type of event (in this case, "AUTHORISATION") |
| eventDate | string | The date and time when the event occurred |
| merchantAccountCode | string | The code identifying the merchant account |
| merchantReference | string | A reference provided by the merchant for this transaction |
| operations | array | List of available operations for this transaction |
| paymentMethod | string | The payment method used (in this case, "amex") |
| pspReference | string | A unique reference for this payment |
| reason | string | Additional information about the authorization |
| success | string | Indicates whether the authorization was successful |

### additionalData
#### Description
Contains additional details about the transaction and payment method.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| expiryDate | string | The expiry date of the payment card |
| authCode | string | The authorization code for the transaction |
| cardSummary | string | A summary (likely last 4 digits) of the card number |
| recurringProcessingModel | string | The model used for recurring payments |
| checkout.cardAddedBrand | string | The brand of the card added during checkout |
| shopperReference | string | A reference identifying the shopper |

### amount
#### Description
Represents the transaction amount and currency.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| currency | string | The currency of the transaction (USD in this case) |
| value | number | The amount of the transaction (0 in this case, likely for authorization only) |

## Dependencies
This JSON file doesn't have direct dependencies, but it's designed to be used in testing scenarios for systems that integrate with Adyen's payment platform.

## Configuration
This file serves as a configuration for testing purposes. The values in this JSON can be modified to simulate different scenarios in test environments.

## API/Interface Reference
While this is not an API endpoint itself, it represents the structure of data that would be sent to an API endpoint that handles Adyen webhook notifications. The receiving endpoint should be capable of parsing and processing this JSON structure.

| Endpoint | Method | Request | Response | Description |
|:---------|:-------|:--------|:---------|:------------|
| (webhook URL) | POST | This JSON structure | Acknowledgement | Adyen sends this data to the configured webhook URL to notify about authorization events |
